messages.message:
<!channel> question about PDFServiceHandler.java.  Does anyone know why we use the value `300` as DPI while trying to extract the image from a PDF page? https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/master/data-services/pdf-services/pdf-tservice/src/main/java/instabase/extraction/pdfservice/PDFServiceHandler.java#L59

This is actually causing OOMs as the image that gets rendered inside the memory becomes large enough to cause OOMs.

With the value being `72` DPI everything works OK
200dpi is your standard xerox setting, which most companies use or at least at cap1, hsbc and a few others
@shaunak thank you for all the performance work youâ€™ve been doing!
300 was a number we chose just to guess that the image quality would be high enough
I would be surprised in 72 would produce good enough image quality. I'd imagine at least 200 is necessary
ok, trying with 200 -- this image is just huge.  I'll show you folks in the office tomorrow
OK, that doesn't work.  Will try to see if there is a way of understanding if we might need to adjust the DPI based on the size of page.
